title: Section C
passagesOne: Questions 46 to 50 are based on the following passage.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn from the passage about reverse graffiti?

Options.text: It uses paint to create anti-pollution images.
It creates a lot of trouble for local residents.
It causes lots of distraction to drivers.
It turns dirty walls into artistic works.

questionsOne.Statement: What do reverse graffiti artists try to do?

Options.text: Publicise their artistic pursuit.
Beautify the city environment.
Raise public awareness of environmental pollution.
Express their dissatisfaction with local govern-ments.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn about Brazilian artist Alexandre Orion?

Options.text: He was good at painting white skulls.
He chose tunnels to do his graffiti art.
He suggested banning all polluting cars.
He was fond of doing creative artworks.

questionsOne.Statement: What does the author imply about Leeds City Council's decision?

Options.text: It is simply absurd.
It is well-informed.
It is rather unexpected.
It is quite sensible.

questionsOne.Statement: How did Sao Paulo city officials handle Alexandre Orion's reverse graffiti?

Options.text: They made him clean all the tunnels in Sao Paulo.
They took drastic action to ban all reverse graffiti.
They charged him with polluting tunnels in the city.
They made it impossible for him to practice his art.

passagesTwo: Questions 51 to 55 are based on the following passage.

questionsTwo.Statement: What do some experts think about paying children for doing chores?

Options.text: It may benefit children in more ways than one.
It may help children learn the worth of labor.
It may not turn out to be the best thing to do.
It may not be accepted by low-income parents.

questionsTwo.Statement: According to Suniya Luthar, doing chores will help children learn to ______________.

Options.text: share family responsibilities
appreciate the value of work
cultivate the spirit of independence
manage domestic affairs themselves

questionsTwo.Statement: What does Ron Lieber think should be the goal of giving children allowances?

Options.text: To help to strengthen family ties.
To teach them how to manage money.
To motivate them to do more housework.
To show parents' appreciation of their help.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does David Lancy say about 18-month-olds?

Options.text: They have a natural instinct to help around the house.
They are too young to request money for what they do.
They should learn to understand family responsibilities.
They need a little incentive to get involved in housework.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does David Lancy advise American parents to do?

Options.text: Set a good example for children in doing housework.
Make children do housework without compensation.
Teach children how to do housework.
Accept children's early bids to help.
